title: Fire Island National Seashore: Calendar
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Calendar             Calendar           Keyword       By Date     Start Date      End Date          Search         Upcoming Events    Showing 34 results    Show ALL instances of recurring events   RSS Feed      Fire Island National Seashore Catch of the Day at Sailors Haven      Time: 2:00 PM to 3:30 PM Location: Fire Island National Seashore: Sailors Haven Fees: Free     Sunday, August 14, 2016 Every Sunday Weekly  from 07/03/2016 to 08/28/2016 Grab a net and see Fire Island's marine life first-hand. View Details      Fire Island National Seashore Catch of the Day at Watch Hill      Time: 2:00 PM to 3:30 PM Location: Fire Island National Seashore: Watch Hill Fees: Free     Sunday, August 14, 2016 Every Sunday Weekly  from 07/03/2016 to 08/28/2016 Wade into the bay for this fun net fishing program and learn about Fire Island's marine life. View Details      Fire Island National Seashore Clams, Clamming and the Great South Bay      Time: 2:00 PM to 3:30 PM Location: Fire Island National Seashore: Sailors Haven Visitor Center Fees: Free program     Sunday, August 14, 2016 Learn about the history of clamming on the Great South Bay, the importance of clams in the marine ecosystem, and go clamming with a park ranger. Wear water shoes. View Details      Fire Island National Seashore Exploring the Salt Marsh: A Guided Canoe Tour      Time: 11:00 AM to 1:00 PM Location: Fire Island National Seashore: Watch Hill Visitor Center Fees: Free     Sunday, August 14, 2016 Every Sunday Weekly & Every Saturday Weekly  from 07/02/2016 to 09/04/2016 Enjoy a 2-hour guided canoe tour through the salt marsh. View Details      Fire Island National Seashore Exploring the Sunken Forest      Time: 11:15 AM to 1:00 PM Location: Fire Island National Seashore: Sailors Haven - Meet at Vistor Center Fees: Free program     Sunday, August 14, 2016 Every Sunday Weekly & Every Wednesday Weekly & Every Thursday Weekly & Every Friday Weekly & Every Saturday Weekly  from 06/29/2016 to 09/04/2016 Come along on a ranger-guided discovery tour of Fire Island’s rare holly maritime forest.    View Details      Fire Island National Seashore Find Your Park Juried Art Exhibition      Location: Fire Island National Seashore Patchogue/Watch Hill Ferry Terminal Fees: Free     Sunday, August 14, 2016 Every Sunday Weekly & Every Saturday Weekly  from 07/31/2016 to 09/04/2016 In celebration of the National Park Service Centennial, national park visitors share their reflections and inspirations of America's special places in this juried art exhibition. View Details      Fire Island National Seashore Fishing Clinic      Time: 2:00 PM to 3:30 PM Location: Fire Island National Seashore Watch Hill Dune Station Fees: Free     Sunday, August 14, 2016 Learn about fish and fishing in the Great South Bay and get for the upcoming Snapper Derbies.  For children ages 7 to 14 and their care givers.   View Details      Fire Island National Seashore Old Mastic House Tours      Time: 10:00 AM to 4:00 PM Location: Fire Island National Seashore: William Floyd Estate Fees: Free program     Sunday, August 14, 2016 Every Sunday Weekly & Every Friday Weekly & Every Saturday Weekly  from 06/03/2016 to 11/11/2016 Enjoy a guided house tour through the ancestral home of William Floyd - one of four signers of the Declaration of Independence from New York State. View Details      Fire Island National Seashore On Exhibit: 1916 Life on the Beach      Location: Fire Island National Seashore: Fire Island Lighthouse Fresnel Lens Building     Sunday, August 14, 2016 Everyday  from 05/14/2016 to 09/05/2016 View the new exhibit at the lighthouse, celebrating the National Park Service's Centennial. View Details      Fire Island National Seashore On Exhibit: The Life of a Keeper in 1916      Location: Fire Island National Seashore: Fire Island Lighthouse     Sunday, August 14, 2016 Everyday  from 07/18/2016 to 09/05/2016 View this new exhibit in celebration of the National Park Service's Centennial. View Details      Fire Island National Seashore Ranger Time: Talks and Tours by the Terrace      Time: 2:00 PM to 3:30 PM Location: Fire Island National Seashore Fire Island Lighthouse     Sunday, August 14, 2016 Meet on the terrace to explore and discover Fire Island history and nature. Topics vary each week. View Details      Fire Island National Seashore Recollections, Collections, and 100 Selections      Time: 10:00 AM to 4:00 PM Location: Fire Island National Seashore William Floyd Estate Fees: Free program     Sunday, August 14, 2016 Every Sunday Weekly & Every Friday Weekly & Every Saturday Weekly  from 07/01/2016 to 11/11/2016 This new exhibit celebrates the 100th anniversary of the National Park Service and the rich history of the William Floyd Estate. 100 items from the park's museum collections never before exhibited will be on display throughout Old Mastic House. View Details      Fire Island National Seashore Seaside Story Time      Time: 10:00 AM to 12:00 PM Location: Fire Island National Seashore Fire Island Lighthouse Fees: Reservations required. Free program.     Wednesday, August 17, 2016 Maritime-themed book reading and activity for children ages 5-8. View Details      Fire Island National Seashore Managing a Dynamic Wilderness      Time: 7:00 PM to 8:00 PM Location: Wilderness Visitor Center     Thursday, August 18, 2016 Learn how the Seashore is responding to the challenges of a dynamic landscape and how other NPS sites have responded to similar challenges. View Details      Fire Island National Seashore Fire Island Fridays      Location: Fire Island National Seashore Watch Hill Dune Station Fees: Free     Friday, August 19, 2016 Every Friday Weekly  from 07/01/2016 to 09/02/2016 Meet at the Dune Station every Friday evening and explore a different Fire Island topic each week. For all ages.   View Details      Fire Island National Seashore Amateur Radio Lighthouse Weekend      Location: Fire Island National Seashore Fire Island Lighthouse     Saturday, August 20, 2016 Join local radio operators as they communicate with other radio operators around the world. View Details      Fire Island National Seashore Junior Rangers at the Beach: “100 Finds”      Location: Fire Island National Seashore Watch Hill and Sailors Haven Fees: Free     Saturday, August 20, 2016 Every Saturday Weekly  from 07/02/2016 to 09/03/2016 Junior Rangers are invited to take a different ranger-guided adventure each week and” Find Your Park” at Fire Island with “100 finds.” View Details      Fire Island National Seashore Snapper Derby      Time: 10:00 AM to 3:00 PM Location: Fire Island National Seashore: Watch Hill Visitor Center Fees: Free     Saturday, August 20, 2016 Bring your fishing pole or use one of ours. View Details      Fire Island National Seashore The 100 New Selections Tour      Time: 10:00 AM to 12:00 PM Location: Fire Island National Seashore William Floyd Estate Fees: Free. Reservations required.     Saturday, August 20, 2016 Celebrate the National Park Centennial and see 100 items from the Seashore's collections on display throughout the Old Mastic House. View Details      Fire Island National Seashore Early Morning Tower Tour      Time: 5:30 AM to 7:00 AM Location: Fire Island National Seashore Fire Island Lighthouse Fees: Reservations required. $20 for FILPS members; $25 for non-members     Sunday, August 21, 2016 See the sunrise from the top of Fire Island Lighthouse. View Details      Fire Island National Seashore Snapper Derby      Time: 10:00 AM to 3:00 PM Location: Fire Island National Seashore Sailors Haven Fees: Free     Sunday, August 21, 2016 Bring your pole or use one of ours! View Details      Fire Island National Seashore Wilderness Art Workshops: Sketching the Wilderness Breach      Time: 10:00 AM to 2:00 PM Location: Fire Island National Seashore Wilderness Visitor Center Fees: Free program.     Sunday, August 21, 2016 Take a 3-mile round-trip hike and sketch the breach. View Details      Fire Island National Seashore Wilderness Art Exhibit      Time: 9:00 AM to 4:00 PM Location: Fire Island National Seashore Wilderness Visitor Center Fees: Free     Thursday, August 25, 2016 Every Sunday Weekly & Every Wednesday Weekly & Every Thursday Weekly & Every Friday Weekly & Every Saturday Weekly  from 08/25/2016 to 09/04/2016 See wilderness-inspired works as part of the centennial celebration.  View Details      Fire Island National Seashore Maritime Music with the Shipmates      Time: 7:00 PM to 8:30 PM Location: Fire Island National Seashore:Wilderness Visitor Center Fees: Free     Friday, August 26, 2016 Enjoy maritime music at the Wilderness Visitor Center.  View Details      Fire Island National Seashore Enchanted Evening: Sunken Forest to Cherry Grove Saunter      Time: 4:30 PM to 7:30 PM Location: Fire Island National Seashore Sailors Haven Visitor Center Fees: Free     Saturday, August 27, 2016 Join a park ranger for an early evening nature tour of the globally rare Sunken Forest, and then a back dune walk to the nearby community of Cherry Grove.  View Details      Fire Island National Seashore Seashore Olympics      Time: 1:00 PM to 3:30 PM Location: Fire Island National Seashore Watch Hill Fees: Free     Saturday, August 27, 2016 Fire Island-themed relay races, a 100 foot crab crawl, and other activities for kids on the beach—all in celebration of the National Park Service Centennial.  View Details      Fire Island National Seashore The Summer Gunner      Time: 10:00 AM to 4:00 PM Location: Fire Island National Seashore William Floyd Estate Fees: Free     Saturday, August 27, 2016 Decoy carver Jaime Reason demonstrates duck and shorebird carving and shares the rich history of decoy carving on the Long Island.  View Details      Fire Island National Seashore Watch Hill to Long Cove Ramble      Time: 9:30 AM to 11:30 AM Location: Fire Island National Seashore Watch Hill Dune Station Fees: Free     Sunday, August 28, 2016 Take a beach walk with a park ranger to the site of Long Cove, once a seaside community and now part of the Otis Pike Fire Island High Dune Wilderness.  View Details      Fire Island National Seashore 100 Natural Things Tour      Time: 9:30 AM to 11:30 AM Location: Fire Island National Seashore William Floyd Estate Fees: Free     Saturday, September 3, 2016 Celebrate the National Park Centennial during this search for 100 "natural things" along the roadsides of the historic William Floyd Estate. View Details      Fire Island National Seashore Annual Sand Creation Contest      Time: 10:00 AM to 3:00 PM Location: Fire Island National Seashore Wilderness Visitor Center Fees: Free     Saturday, September 3, 2016 Let national parks be your inspiration to sand creations during this annual sand sculpting contest. View Details      Fire Island National Seashore Pollinator Garden Prep      Time: 10:00 AM to 1:00 PM Location: Fire Island National Seashore Patchogue/Watch Hill Ferry Terminal Fees: Free     Saturday, September 3, 2016 Use your green thumbs to help maintain this native plant pollinator garden. The garden is a registered monarch butterfly way-station and needs your help to keep it growing.  View Details      Fire Island National Seashore Annual Sand Creation Contest      Time: 10:00 AM to 3:00 PM Location: Fire Island National Seashore Sailors Haven Fees: Free     Sunday, September 4, 2016 Let national parks be your inspiration to sand creations during this annual sand sculpting contest. View Details      Fire Island National Seashore Annual Sand Creation Contest      Time: 10:00 AM to 3:00 PM Location: Fire Island National Seashore Watch Hill Fees: Free     Sunday, September 4, 2016 Let national parks be your inspiration to sand creations during this annual sand sculpting contest. View Details      Fire Island National Seashore Pick It Up! Coastal Cleanup      Time: 6:00 PM to 8:00 PM Location: Fire Island National Seashore Wilderness Visitor Center Fees: Free program     Saturday, September 10, 2016 Roll up your sleeves towards a solution to marine pollution and take the centennial challenge to help clear Fire Island's shore of 2016 pounds of marine debris in 2016. View Details                For More Information  The Summer 2016 Program Guide is available. Please e-mail us for a copy.   For the most up-to-date information on events please call 631-687-4780 weekdays and 631-281-3010 on weekends.  Follow Us:  Facebook/FireIslandNPS,  Twitter/FireIslandNPS Instagram/FireIslandNPS
